process deployment CI/ Continuous Delivery Monitoring Logging

SIZEBAR Maven:

Apache maven is a powerful dependency and build manager that has had significant impact on development of open source java apps. It favors “convention-over-configuration” which saves considerable ramp-up time. Its dependency and artifact management systems allow all dependencies to be completely specified in a single manifest file, so app can be built, tested, deployed, and run with a simple and consistent command set.

Maven support in Stackto comes in the form of Heroko build-packs (see below.) But it’s worth noting that if maven produces an artifact that

Stackato understands (i.e., framework listed in this article) then a common approach is to build the app with maven locally, then push the resulting app to stackato.
